metadata.feature_description: View, sort, and manage the list of custom URLs

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages > Select 'URL Type Test Page'

steps.expected: URLs for this page section is visible
steps.actual: URLs for this page section displayed with system-generated URL

steps.action: Add custom URL '/test-custom-url-alpha' with Active (200) status
steps.expected: Custom URL is created and displayed in list
steps.actual: Custom URL successfully created and displayed with correct properties

steps.action: Add another custom URL '/zebra-url-redirect' with Redirect (301) status
steps.expected: Second custom URL is created and displayed
steps.actual: Second custom URL created successfully with Redirect (301) type

steps.expected: URLs should be sorted alphabetically by path
steps.actual: Column header is not clickable - no sorting functionality triggered

issues: Sorting by URL path is not available in the UI. The column headers are not clickable for sorting. Backend API supports sorting (sortField parameter) but UI does not expose this functionality.

steps.action: Attempt to sort URLs by locale
steps.expected: Locale column header should allow sorting
steps.actual: No Locale column visible in the URL list UI. Backend API supports Locale sorting field but UI does not display locale information or provide sorting controls.

issues: Locale column is not displayed in the URL list. Backend supports sorting by locale (SortingFields.Locale) but UI does not expose this feature.

steps.action: Click on 'URL TYPE' column header to sort by status code
steps.expected: URLs should be sorted by status code (Active 200 vs Redirect 301)
steps.actual: Column header click does not trigger any sorting action

issues: Sorting by status code is not available in the UI. The URL TYPE column header is not clickable. Backend API supports status code sorting but UI does not expose this functionality.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test ascending and descending sort orders

steps.action: Attempt to toggle sort order by clicking column headers multiple times
steps.expected: Clicking column header should toggle between ascending and descending order
steps.actual: No sorting toggle functionality is available. Column headers do not respond to clicks.

issues: Sort order toggle is not available in the UI. Backend API supports ascending/descending via sortOrder parameter but UI does not expose this functionality.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify correct display of URL properties

steps.action: Examine URL list for correct display of all properties
steps.expected: URL path, URL Type, and Generated By columns should display correct values
steps.actual: All URL properties displayed correctly: URL path shows full path, URL Type shows 'Active (200)' or 'Redirect (301)', Generated By shows 'Automatic' for system URLs and 'SuperUser Account' for custom URLs

steps.action: Verify custom URLs have edit/delete icons
steps.expected: Custom URLs should display edit and delete action icons
steps.actual: Edit (pencil) and Delete (trash) icons are visible for custom URLs created by users

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test with empty custom URL list

steps.action: Navigate to 'Search Results' page which has no custom URLs
steps.expected: URL list should display only system-generated URLs
steps.actual: URL list correctly displays single system-generated URL '/Search-Results' with Active (200) status and 'Automatic' as generator

steps.action: Verify Add URL button is available for adding custom URLs
steps.expected: Add URL button should be visible and clickable
steps.actual: Add URL button is visible and available for adding custom URLs to the page

observations: The backend API (UrlManagementServiceController.cs) supports sorting via sortField and sortOrder parameters with three sort fields: URL (1), Locale (2), and Status (3).
The UI does not expose sorting controls through clickable column headers - this appears to be a UI limitation rather than a backend issue.
Code review confirms sorting functionality exists in GetSortedUrls method but the Page Settings UI component does not implement sorting controls.
The 'creation date' sorting mentioned in test scenarios is NOT supported by the backend - only URL, Locale, and Status sorting fields are implemented.
Custom URLs are correctly differentiated from system-generated URLs with 'SuperUser Account' vs 'Automatic' in the Generated By column.
The feature correctly displays URL properties including path, status code type, and generator information.
